alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:58AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Jackson and northern Rockcastle Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 157 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Conway, or 9 miles north of Mount Vernon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mount Vernon, Roundstone, Wildie and Renfro Valley around 205 AM EDT. Climax, Disputanta, Bummer, Hummel, Morrill, Muellersville, Dudley Station and Orlando around 210 AM EDT. Goochland, Threelinks, Johnetta, Cooksburg and Clover Bottom around 215 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Loam, Eglon, Collingsworth, Sandgap, Robinet, Jep Hill, Kerby Knob, Dango, Waneta, Middlefork, Ardery, Carico and Brazil. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 63 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
